Text: Today I met with @clackamascounty to learn more about their plans to redevelop affordable housing units at Hillside Manor. We talked about how federal funds from #BuildBackBetter could be used to help expand the project and offer more services to current and future residents. https://t.co/AgDDQ2DCYV

I met with Planned Parenthood leadership at their Milwaukie clinic to discuss reproductive healthcare issues in Congress. Thank you @PPCW for providing vital healthcare services in our community and for having me today! https://t.co/Lwp5KiSS3f
This robust, once in a generation investment will help transform Oregon’s infrastructure and provide federal funding for district priorities like the Aurora-Donald Interchange Project.
Thanks to the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw I championed, Oregon is set to receive $3.4 billion for federal aid highway programs and $268 million for bridge replacements and repairs.

.@OregonDOT has begun Phase 1 construction on the Aurora-Donald Interchange Project! I’ve long fought to bring this vital project for #OR05 online. I testified before the @TransportDems last April on the importance of getting district priorities like this across the finish line. https://t.co/XzJ1lKwu76
https://t.co/WwScHDz9As

In today’s @EnergyCommerce hearing I pressed @NTIAgov for timely distribution of the $100M in broadband funding I secured for Oregon in the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw to close the digital divide, enhance competitiveness, promote equity & create good jobs for Oregonians. ⬇

I will be holding a virtual town hall on Wednesday, Feb. 23 from 6-7 p.m. PT. This is a great way for #OR05 constituents to ask me questions and hear about my work in Congress. You'll need to register to participate. I hope to see you!

Register here ➡️ https://t.co/FCt0X7K7ps https://t.co/VNriWVwFxW

Proud to announce @USDA has awarded a $1.5 million grant to @ORagriculture to support Oregon seafood processors, vessels, and workers impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. #DeliveringForOregon
https://t.co/vtcE3vUXKr

Whether they are serving abroad or domestically to help fight wildfires or respond to COVID, members of the OR Army National Guard and Air National Guard answer the call and get the job done. I'm honored by their service and proud to work on ways to improve their lives. https://t.co/LJXhHKgz2a

Excited to watch @CanbyHighSchool grad Jackie Wiles hit the slopes for @TeamUSA at the #WinterOlympics. You're making our hometown proud. The Cougar community will be rooting for you! https://t.co/2zL31Zuz5d

Proud to join @repbonamici and the Oregon delegation in support of additional Emergency Rental Assistance program funding. This program has been a lifeline for Oregonians struggling to pay rent and cover housing costs during the COVID crisis. https://t.co/OIZ33HSJD0
Happy 163rd Birthday, Oregon! https://t.co/l6UnQCzLO3
https://t.co/3lg2LcWjFR

Congress must fight climate change head-on by passing a bill that builds on the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law's major climate investments. I am committed to being a leader in this fight to protect Oregon's environment, communities and economy.
 
Read my piece in @thebulletin. ⬇️

Oregon will soon receive its first $8M in investments in #EV charging infrastructure through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. This will help fight the climate crisis by reducing carbon pollution, all while creating good-paying jobs for Oregonians. #ElectrifyingAmerica https://t.co/REa2GfuYaa

All workers have to the right to organize, and workers on Capitol Hill are no different. I support and will recognize the right of Congressional staff to form a union and have a voice in their workplace.

Had the opportunity to meet with @SOORstate during #SOHillDay to discuss the importance of inclusive health, education, and sports. Thank you for the life changing work and programs that you provide for Oregonians! https://t.co/iy1i9waqr2

No one should ever be persecuted or abused because of their sexual orientation or gender identity. I voted for the #GlobalRespectAct which would deny U.S. visas to people and Countries who commit human rights abuses against members of the LGBTQI+ community. https://t.co/NFMMta0VBj

I participated in an @EnergyCommerce #HealthSub hearing on the critical importance of investing in biomedical research to fuel breakthrough cures and treatments for the most devastating, rare diseases. 
https://t.co/rZS7O3Eml6

Oregonians rely on @USPS to deliver medications, vote and more. I championed the bipartisan #PostalServiceReformAct to strengthen the USPS, make it financially sustainable and address delivery delays. This will ensure Oregonians have access to the essential services they need. https://t.co/fVdMflxBFR

I joined @RepJohnKatko, @RepStephMurphy and @RepAshleyHinson in introducing bipartisan legislation to equip Congress with better information on how major bills could impact inflation. This will help protect our hard-won gains & keep Oregon moving forward. 
https://t.co/kWHkENJ0YR

Today I voted for bipartisan legislation to #EndForcedArbitration in sexual assault and sexual harassment cases. This legislation will ensure that survivors' voices are heard - because no one should be forced to surrender their right to justice as a condition of employment.

We honor the life and service of Austin Smith, a volunteer firefighter who tragically passed away yesterday after responding to a three-alarm barn fire in St. Paul. Austin's heroism, bravery and dedication to his community will never be forgotten. https://t.co/bRbqePr054

Learn more about how #AmericaCOMPETES will provide critical relief for Oregon's 5th District.⬇
https://t.co/i6x9nd59HU

I voted for the #AmericaCOMPETES Act today to tackle rising consumer prices, inflation, labor shortages, supply chain disruptions and more issues impacting Oregon families and businesses. I spoke on the House floor in support of the comprehensive package shortly before it passed. https://t.co/GfgvseByd8
https://t.co/63YpzQi16j

Lowering prescription drug costs is my top priority, and I'm proud of my work in #BuildBackBetter on this huge issue. In today’s @EnergyCommerce #HealthSub hearing I asked the @US_FDA what they’re doing to bring more biosimilars and generics to market to drive down drug costs. ⬇️

I’m proud I helped secure $500K for the Siletz Tribe to plan out their #broadband infrastructure future. This grant is a crucial step in their connectivity process to find broadband solutions that meet the specific needs of the Siletz community.  https://t.co/zfY5nscpvh

Oregon is home to over 1.4 million acres of wetlands, including Nestucca Bay National Wildlife Refuge in Tillamook County. On #WorldWetlandsDay I remain committed to the preservation and protection of these critical ecosystems and the diverse wildlife species that inhabit them. https://t.co/PAQzYCLsW5

Addressing the high cost of prescription drugs for Oregonians is one of my top priorities and with my colleagues, I am pushing hard to get these provisions I championed across the finish line. https://t.co/FC922lue4h

I met with leaders from Tillamook County yesterday to talk about the needs of their communities and how we can work together to increase broadband access, affordable housing and emergency preparedness in the county. https://t.co/muuR6Rgaya

Proud to join this effort! Oregonians faced devastating wildfires, extreme heat waves, droughts and severe storms - all in the past year alone. Now is the time to act on the climate crisis and secure these vital provisions. https://t.co/Q7Vc4M9OPi

I spoke with leaders from Lincoln County this morning. Their stories exemplify the continued need for workforce housing, access to affordable childcare and meaningful legislation to fight the climate crisis taking a heavy toll on Oregon’s coastal communities. https://t.co/tgBeN9APGl

Did you know that only 10% of post-use plastic is recycled today? I visited @Agilyx to learn more about the facility’s advanced recycling operations and its role in accelerating the shift to a low-carbon economy. Learn more about this local drop-off site: https://t.co/uj9X63SkZg https://t.co/4xeC2vL6RU

Tune into the @1190KEX Mark Mason Show at 12:15 p.m. PT today to hear me talk about the latest on voting rights, inflation, COVID-19, and the infrastructure investments I delivered for Oregon. https://t.co/1qtAPDUGNZ

I spoke with leaders from Polk County on Zoom yesterday. They underscored the need for reliable highspeed internet, affordable childcare and infrastructure investments for Oregonians and communities across the country. https://t.co/bovGOuWf9Z

A big thanks to @ChargePointnet, @AAAOregonIdaho and the Salem Service Center for hosting me at this new EV charging station! The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law I championed will bring $52M to Oregon to build out our EV charging network, which will help fight the climate crisis. https://t.co/6YPYdjJIW9
By keeping their memories alive, we ensure new generations #NeverForget what happened. We must listen and learn from this tragedy and do all we can to stand up to hatred and bigotry everywhere.

Today is Holocaust Remembrance Day, where we honor the millions of people systemically targeted and murdered by the Nazis and pay tribute to those who survived. Organizations like @AuschwitzMuseum and @HolocaustMuseum and many others around the world share their stories. https://t.co/skUW9lvORk

Today I met with @LCVoters @OLCV @oeconline @enviroregon to discuss the climate provisions in #BuildBackBetter. These investments address the critical issues facing Oregonians and are a step forward to better protect our state from extreme weather events like wildfires & drought. https://t.co/7Upqfgbl6c

I want to thank all the local leaders in Clackamas County who joined me this morning to hear their thoughts on issues including tolling, and how federal funding can help local governments ensure our families have access to affordable housing, childcare, and more. https://t.co/7ay3IFvKms

The North Jetty is also currently on track to be repaired. Having both the North and South Jetties fixed will be a tremendous victory for these coastal communities and will help protect lives and the businesses who depend on safe operations in this area. https://t.co/viSW4C0wqG

I am proud to announce @USACEHQ released their Fiscal Year 2022 Work Plan which includes $62 million to fully repair the Tillamook South Jetty. This project has been a long-term priority for my office due to the dangerous conditions of the current jetty. https://t.co/81i44ADoag

I had a great conversation with local leaders in Marion County yesterday about what's going on in their communities and how I can help in areas like infrastructure, natural disaster recovery and economic development. https://t.co/siUOhn7RCM
I am calling on the Senate to pass the Women’s Health Protection Act without delay because everyone must be free to make the best decisions for themselves, their families and their lives.

The 49th anniversary of Roe v. Wade comes as reproductive freedom is under unprecedented attack across the country. In Oregon, the right to choose is fully protected under state law, but many Americans' reproductive rights are restricted by political inference. This is wrong. https://t.co/oymM1DFKPx
⬆️ This 10-year, $3 billion plan was made possible through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law I championed. #DeliveringForOregon

I'm happy to see the @forestservice putting a plan in place to build on my efforts to promote hazardous fuels reduction and wildfire prevention through responsible forest management which includes thinning, prescribed burns and removing dead/dying trees. https://t.co/e7Gww9RM17

Wildfires devastated Oregon in recent years, and #OR05 is especially vulnerable. In my @EnergyCommerce #SubEnergy hearing this week, I pressed @ENERGY for timely delivery of the $39M in wildfire mitigation funding for Oregon that I championed in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. https://t.co/XZREvN5q4O

I will be holding a virtual town hall on Tuesday, January 25 from 6-7 p.m. PT. This is a great way for #OR05 constituents to ask me questions and hear about my work in Congress. You'll need to register to participate. I hope to see you!

Register here ➡️ https://t.co/4dpCJrnQ35 https://t.co/pidivEQeho

On #MLKDay, we honor Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. by continuing his legacy of championing the sacred right to vote. We must pass voting reform to ensure all Americans have equal access to the ballot box like we have in Oregon because “the time is always right to do what is right."

Wildfires and extreme weather fueled by the climate crisis have devastated Oregon communities, taking an especially heavy toll on #OR05. The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law I championed includes $5B to help harden our electrical grid to face these disasters. https://t.co/iTkZK4A2MY

Starting today, @HHSGov is holding a free #COVID19 vaccination clinic at Spirit Mountain Casino in Grand Ronde. This month-long clinic runs 7-days a week, has all vaccine/booster types available and is open to everyone. Testing is available after Jan. 19.
https://t.co/Id5WEzj3do

Investing in our bridges means creating and supporting good-paying jobs. Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law I championed, Oregon is receiving more than $268 million over the next five years to upgrade our bridges and put our communities back to work. https://t.co/pIkzh2Z70n
🚨 A reminder – tomorrow, January 15 is the last day to sign up for quality, affordable health insurance through @ORMarketplace. Preview plans and sign up today. ⬇️ https://t.co/CJvsAChgxf

“2022 will be a year of massive water infrastructure investments." Oregon communities will benefit from $529 million in water and sewer improvements from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. Clean water and safe, healthy communities—that's a big deal! https://t.co/k0eegLvZf4

The @OregonGuard is always there to serve our state, through the COVID-19 crisis, wildfires, severe storms and more. I proudly voted for the Guard and Reserve GI Bill Parity Act to ensure they have equal access to the GI Bill benefits they deserve. #EveryDayInUniformCounts https://t.co/JkQMvQWVRj

Proud to work with @RepCindyAxne on this new bill that would open @DeptVetAffairs work-study programs to student veterans enrolled part-time in higher education programs. This ensures our vets are better supported to pursue their education while providing for their families. https://t.co/rWVvFn7A78

Oregonians often speak with me about the impacts of the climate crisis they're seeing at the Oregon Coast. New @OregonState research confirms fragile marine ecosystems are at risk. Climate investments I secured in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will help and are on the way. https://t.co/niSap9IbbO

Oregonians faced a challenging year. The bold bills I championed in 2021 met the issues head on, putting our state on a path to recover and rebuild stronger than ever.
 
Read more about my highlights fighting for #OR05, and sign up for future updates here: https://t.co/7VpjaljauP
https://t.co/oYWrsJ3AVX

"The pandemic has shown clearly we have to have more points of outreach to people, so they actually get the care they need in a setting that they're comfortable with..."

Learn how the @VimClackamas clinic move to @ClackCollege will better serve health needs in our communities.⬇️

I had a great meeting with @VimClackamas to discuss how they are going to use #AmericanRescuePlan funds to renovate and relocate to a new space at @ClackCollege. With this investment they can expand their services to better help the uninsured and most in need in our community. https://t.co/iwSraotfv4

It is painful to remember the attack, but we must keep drawing lessons from it to heal and ensure it never happens again. I promise to keep working in Congress to protect our democracy for all Oregonians and help our country move forward together.

One year has passed, but we cannot allow ourselves to forget what happened, or the election fraud lies that fueled the violence. The insurrectionists must face justice because their extremism and hate do not belong in America.

The January 6, 2021 attack on our U.S. Capitol is one of the darkest days in American history. Lives were lost and many more were endangered, including those of my staff, colleagues and the law enforcement officers who risked everything to protect us.

Oregonians faced climate-related extreme weather last year, with severe storms and record heat taking a heavy toll on #OR05 communities. The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law provides over $50B to make Oregon safer and more resilient to the climate crisis. https://t.co/WY9YajyoD7

There are volunteer opportunities to work on a new trail coming to Silver Falls State Park.

Oregonians need targeted legislation to lower prescription drug costs, improve childcare access, expand the ACA and fight the climate crisis. I will continue to work with my colleagues to find common ground in the New Year, so we can deliver on these critical issues.
Thank you for all you did to protect #OR05 and keep Oregonians safe! https://t.co/pfFEClTY6u

Excellent news for Oregon crabbers! On-time start, good weather, historic hauls and a record-breaking opening price. @MyODFW says crabbers hauled in 3.9M pounds of Dungeness crab during opening week alone. Looks like crab is on the menu for the holidays!🦀 https://t.co/Xn0ysi7hlr

I met with @USDA & Oregon ag & forestry leaders this week to discuss disaster relief, including the $10B I secured for farmers & ranchers impacted by excessive heat & other extreme weather events, as well as the need to include specialty crop coverage in the next farm bill. https://t.co/DB5a5Gni4W

I had a great time visiting Deb Barnes’ journalism students at the Sabin-Schellenberg Center in Milwaukie today! I am constantly inspired by our next generation of leaders and grateful for teachers like Deb who devote countless hours to promote student success. https://t.co/nnHsacAaLi

Thank you @ESS_info for having me over to learn more about your iron flow batteries. I’m always happy to see high-tech manufacturing being done right here in Oregon, especially when it’s on the forefront of leading us to a sustainable, clean energy future. https://t.co/HPqtTUUG1R

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is key to combating extreme weather events like wildfires and the climate crisis that’s fueling them. 

Proud to have championed these major investments, including $39M to increase firefighting coordination and wildfire prevention in our state. https://t.co/IVjgqmHLxK
Read more about my roundtable and how the major investments in wildfire recovery and prevention will better protect our communities.⬇️ https://t.co/mYgV4M5zLG

It was an honor to host @SecVilsack, @OregonGovBrown and our state's agriculture and forestry leaders today to discuss how the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law's historic wildfire mitigation funding will support firefighting efforts and curb the devastating disasters in Oregon. https://t.co/NmI57C4NKN

Oregon's agriculture and forestry leaders also joined us to discuss how the landmark law will make the state stronger and more resilient to face extreme heat and droughts in the future. https://t.co/bffRmqz4w7

The drought resiliency funding in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is critical for our Oregon farmers, like those at family-owned Woodburn Nursery & Azaleas. Thank you, @USDA Under Secretary Bonnie for joining me on a tour there today. https://t.co/ucyksIuzC6

Thank you @HillsboroHops and @HillsboroMedCtr! This vaccine clinic is a great reminder that everyone 5 years of age and older is now eligible to get a free #COVID19Vaccine. It's the safest, most effective tool we have to protect our communities. https://t.co/x9KHcs8ZHx

I'm a proud champion of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, which makes the first-ever national investment in #EV charging infrastructure. These EV charging stations are going to fight the climate crisis and pave the way to Oregon’s clean energy future.

The Ocean Shipping Reform Act I cosponsored overwhelmingly passed the House! The critical reforms supported by my @HouseBlueDogs will help solve huge supply chain issues at our ports, like shipping container issues hurting Oregon ag and forest industries. https://t.co/loGbhkq0r1

The @CTGRgov is receiving a $1.7M COVID-19 relief @HUDgov grant, funded through the #AmericanRescuePlan that I helped pass. This will help the Tribe build a new health facility and purchase an ambulance to better meet their unique health and cultural needs.
On this #PearlHarborRemembranceDay and every day, we honor them and all those who fought to protect our freedom in the days that followed by sharing their stories for future generations.
80 years cannot fade the courage and sacrifice of those who lost their lives in the attack on Pearl Harbor, and the bravery of survivors like Dick Higgins in Bend. https://t.co/JC83UKqX2F

Congratulations to the @SilvertonFoxes on their first state football title since 1991! https://t.co/nZ912Zzvxf
I will miss him sorely as a friend and absolute authority in all things transportation and infrastructure. He has earned a well deserved rest after 36 years representing the best of Oregon.

As a member of the @ProChoiceCaucus, I was proud to stand in solidarity with my colleagues in support of #RoeVWade today as the Supreme Court begins deliberating the biggest threat to a woman’s right to choose in 50 years. Jobless claims hit a 50-year low! Proud to have passed the #AmericanRescuePlan to help get our nation to this milestone. The new Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and the #BuildBackBetterAct are also good-paying job creators that will open up new opportunities for Oregonians. https://t.co/Qp7d1B71v9

Apply right away if you think you are unable to afford December rent. If you completed and submitted your application, it will be processed as soon as possible. If you have an incomplete application, you need to complete it before 12/1 at 11:59 p.m. ⬇️ https://t.co/vDtxCaKYsF
Today, we honor the Grand Ronde and Siletz tribes as cornerstones of the community and celebrate the great strides they have made to rebuild their nations. https://t.co/YUq7RqRdXb

This month marks Restoration Day anniversaries for the Confederated Tribes of Grand Ronde and the Confederated Tribes of Siletz Indians, where visionary tribal leaders succeeded in restoring their tribes as sovereign nations following the Termination era.

“It’s truly historic in size and scope." The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will deliver more than $5B to Oregon over the coming years. These incredible investments will transform communities across our state.https://t.co/SMSx6oLIDK

Coupled with our historic Infrastructure Law, BBB will further deliver transformational changes for Oregon while balancing the economic health of our country. I look forward to working with the Senate to get this across the finish line. https://t.co/SMQYZ6izbl

✅ Improve childcare access, costs and shortages
✅ Expand ACA coverage 
✅ Provide real protections and opportunities for immigrant communities
✅ Implement policies that take on the climate crisis to protect Oregon from wildfires while creating good-paying clean energy jobs

✅ Caps seniors’ out-of-pocket costs to $2K/yr which can be paid over the year in smaller monthly payments
✅ Caps insulin to no more than $35/mo
✅ Incentivizes generic drugs to boost competition

BBB also includes more critical needs for Oregon families and businesses to:

✅ BBB includes my prescription drug price reduction piece—this will be the most sweeping improvement in reducing drug costs since the inception of Medicare Part D over 15 years ago
✅ Limits existing drug price increases to the rate of inflation

When drug pricing was left out of Build Back Better—the single greatest opportunity we have to allow Medicare to finally negotiate—I led the charge to incorporate the meaningful, commonsense plan that passed in the package today:

I joined my colleagues to pass a smartly targeted, paid-for #BuildBackBetterAct in the House that delivers on Oregonians’ top priorities. I am very proud my plan to drastically lower prescription drug costs for all Americans, especially our seniors, is a core part of the bill. https://t.co/GThKMLbsA4

I will vote for the Build Back Better Act tonight. I am confident moving this legislation forward is the best decision for Oregon families, businesses and our economy. I look forward to working with the Senate to further improve the bill to deliver these investments to our state.

Over $100M is coming to our state to get everyone connected, especially in rural communities. This includes nearly 137,000 Oregonians who currently lack internet access. Our infrastructure law is a game changer.

Our new infrastructure law is “poised to help students across the country, especially those living in rural areas and tribal communities” by getting them connected to affordable and reliable high-speed broadband. https://t.co/BPPxWurI9x
https://t.co/Xvha4dkm8o

I am once again championing the bipartisan IDEA Full Funding Act with my colleagues because Congress must finally pay our share of the crucial program under the law. This would provide essential resources so Oregon school districts can ensure a quality education for all students.

It was also great to see folks from the @OregonState Global Hemp Innovation Center at the summit! OSU is the only hemp seed certifier in the state, and one of only four in the country. Their research is critical to helping the hemp industry succeed. https://t.co/LrrwBpMlpH

Thank you, @NatHempCouncil for inviting me to speak at the Hemp Business Summit this morning. I enjoyed talking about my bill that would have the @US_FDA regulate CBD as a dietary supplement. This would be a big win for hemp farmers in Oregon and around the country. https://t.co/sJIvBecz4B

It was an honor to be at the @WhiteHouse today to see @POTUS sign our historic bipartisan infrastructure bill into law. I am proud to bring this incredible win home for Oregon families and businesses. https://t.co/Oas1JhGS85

I’m excited to join my colleagues to watch @POTUS sign my bipartisan infrastructure bill into law soon! With over $5B coming to Oregon over the next few years, these once-in-a-century investments will transform our infrastructure systems and create jobs across our state. https://t.co/6sr5UM5xGv https://t.co/Cyl8OjYWzA
https://t.co/CpiHhX4pbG

Another @FCC Emergency Connectivity Fund wave is coming to Oregon, bringing the state’s total to $59.6M. I secured this funding in the #AmericanRescuePlan so our schools and libraries have the resources they need to keep our students connected and learning through the pandemic.⬇️

Thanks Clackamas County Business Alliance for inviting me to speak on Friday. Last week’s passage of the historic bipartisan infrastructure bill was a huge win for Oregon, and it was a pleasure to answer your questions about how what’s happening in Congress benefits us at home. https://t.co/4L4ZVek1au

We can't thank the @USCG and partner agencies in Tillamook County enough for keeping everyone safe during this evacuation in Neskowin. The heavy rainfall is fueling widespread flooding and mudslide threats in many parts of Oregon. Please be careful everyone. https://t.co/cdBS55XSJB

We haven’t been this close to passing monumental drug pricing reforms in decades, and we are honored to deliver on our promise to enact these life changing policies with @RepKathleenRice, @RepStephMurphy and @SenatorSinema to ensure a better health care system for everyone. ⬇️

☑️ Exposes bad actors and other problems that have increased drug costs
☑️ Closes loopholes and increases transparency in the health care system

☑️ Allows Medicare to negotiate prices on a large majority of the top 50 most expensive drugs that have been on the market for a set number of years
☑️ Promotes lower-cost options, such as generic drugs, to boost competition

☑️ Lowers seniors’ cost-sharing and caps their out-of-pocket spending to $2K/year, with costs payable through a lower monthly amount over the course of the calendar year rather than all at once
☑️ Caps insulin at $35/month

Today marks a solemn milestone in America: the 20th anniversary of the 9/11 attacks.

We will always remember those who lost their lives, and honor all the heroic first responders and firefighters, many of whom made the ultimate sacrifice to save others.

We will #NeverForget.
If you are having thoughts of suicide, remember you are #NotAlone. Please call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-8255 for 24/7 support.

I have supported many bills in Congress to address the public health crisis of suicide, including to pass the STANDUP Act which aims to prevent teen suicides, but on this #WorldSuicidePreventionDay I committed to doing much more to help save lives.

Far too many families in Oregon and across the country are impacted by suicide, which is 10th leading cause of death overall in the U.S. There is an especially high suicide-rate among our veterans, many of whom are suffering post-traumatic stress after serving our country.
Suicide is a deeply personal, difficult topic to talk about, but we must have honest conversations about mental health conditions so we can raise suicide awareness and prevention.
